channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown shrubbery blocking light, 22nd August
item.description:
Overgrown shrubbery blocking street light ao it's pitch black, plus overgrown at bottom of the bridge, shedding all over it making it dangerous to walk on

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pembroke Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous overgrown and overhanging trees, 22nd August
item.description:
All the trees at the end of Berwick Crescent from 1-15 in the centre of the road are excessively overgrown and overhanging into the road and effecting visibility. They urgently needed to be inspected and cut back. A number of them also have excessive growth at the bottom of the tree too. All the branches and leaves are hanging into the road and over cars. It’s been like this for a long time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Berwick Crescent, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extreme wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 87-89 Fernhead Road., 22nd August
item.description:
Extreme wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 87 - 89 Fernhead Road. This fouling is about a foot away from the kerb. There is also small droplets of dog fouling near the tree that is in front of 95 Fernhead Road. People get in and out their cars besides this tree and people cross the road besides this tree and children often play around this tree. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cluster of potholes at many places in the street, 22nd August
item.description:
The potholes have been there for at least two years now. I am not sure if they cause an accident but definitely cars need to be slowed down driving through it. Given there is school in the street, appreciate if you can fix them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harlington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This vehicle now appears to have cloned number plates., 22nd August
item.description:
The original reg plates EN60EPO have been removed and reg plates WM57DDF fitted, they are NOT legitimate plates as they do not show any Motor Dealer identification. The smashed windscreen has been covered so it is not easy/possible to view the chassis number details. The Police have been informed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Venners Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped by Friday night, 22nd August
item.description:
46 Cheval Place as usual. Please don’t let it sit there until next week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Cheval Place, Chelsea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish AGAIN, 22nd August
item.description:
More dumped rubbish Been here for over a week please remove asap Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manaton Close, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 22nd August
item.description:
Litter along and around the pavement on the long hedge that runs alongside The Crescent BR3 1DU along the length of the hedge, in the hedge and close to the hedge and in the road/gutter. You could say the area starts at What3words tent.tidy.movie. The hedge, pavement, gutter of The Crescent. This hedge borders the car park of Marks and Spencer. There are plastic bottles, glass bottles, cans, broom and separate handle, plastic wraps, paper wrappers, etc. Additionally, the bin on the corner of The Crescent/church avenue is full. Hopefully you will now be able to locate the problem area. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Goose by lake, 22nd August
item.description:
This is a dead goose lying just next to the lake. It isn't clear how it died but it looks like it could have been harmed based on it's neck position. I have checked for signs of life but it doesn't look like there are any.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti put on the pavement, 22nd August
item.description:
Someone sprayed and used the name God on the floor. This is extremely disrespectful. Writing the name God and letting people step on this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shoreditch High Street, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on Nexus Apartment buildings (2 areas), 22nd August
item.description:
Graffiti has appeared on 2 areas at 145 Great Suffolk St SE1 1AU. 1st area is on roller door (silver paint) facing Borough High St, 2nd area is on brickwork facing Redman Estate Green (black paint).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 280, Borough High Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone has left this rubbish on the pavement, 22nd August
item.description:
Someone has left this rubbish on the pavement. The bin men have already been.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Griffin Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fruit and veg stall decomposing waste, 22nd August
item.description:
Waste left over from the food and veg stall is smeared all over the street and impossible to clean up. They bring rotten/ over ripe food to their stalls which creates fruit flies which come into all the nearby flats. The birds take the over ripe fruit and drop it on all the balconies and create more waste problems. The street is never clean as it is a continuous cycle of over ripe fruit at market, bins overflowing, bins left all day, excess waste smeared on street, repeat.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54-58, Rye Lane, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public litter bin overflowing, 22nd August
item.description:
The bin behind the engineers' cabin is overflowing with rubbish and dog poo bags. People are now fly-tipping around it. Please cleanse the area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two bags of rubbish left on the pavement by the signpost, 22nd August
item.description:
Someone has left two bags of rubbish on the pavement by the signpost, and foxes have eaten through the bags.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Griffin Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped tree branches, 22nd August
item.description:
Company fitting scaffolding opposite cut tree and dumped branches in the road also obstructing pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kendall Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Overgrown greenery, 22nd August
item.description:
This path is impossible to walk on any more safe. Its so overgrown. This path made of 5 tiles. Now visible left barly one... In my 5 years of use this path, I can confirm, its never been maintained. Many times I have reported this problem to council but they keep redirecting me to tfl.. and their ..back to council....

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orion Road, Colney Hatch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence in desperate need of repair/replacement, 22nd August
item.description:
In the side road between Nos.17 and 15 Beechfield Road is a section of fence has been crumbling away for the past year, it must be repaired as soon as possible as it is dangerous due to splinters and nails etc. The adjacent temporary metal fence is also inadequate; it does not provide an effective barrier between the park and road and also falls over sometimes, though this has been fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beechfield Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car been left for 1 week in the same spot parked half on the road and half on the curb, 22nd August
item.description:
It has been parked very badly and appears abandoned. With many parking tickets on the window.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Park Road, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Huge flag hosted on roundabout lamppost, 22nd August
item.description:
Big Union Jack flag strung up on lampost in middle of roundabout.
